name: NPR
text:
President Trump won the 2016 election, in which 25% of ballots were cast by mail. By railing against absentee voting, "you potentially jeopardize your own interest," says Tom Ridge, Pennsylvania's former Republican governor.
https://t.co/hFML9laXRP

name: NPR
text:
Phoenix has joined several cities across Arizona requiring residents to wear masks in public spaces amid a sharp spike in COVID-19 cases.

Additionally, businesses have the right to refuse service to anyone who doesn't comply with the order.
https://t.co/9RtllETYZZ

name: NPR
text: The Pentagon is lifting travel restrictions for military personnel in 46 states  â€” despite a rise in new coronavirus infections in 23 of those states.  https://t.co/OscVsKKz2h

name: NPR
text: AMC Theaters now says it will require face coverings for customers in all of its theaters reopening in July. The change came after an outcry against the company for not making it a mandate in the first place. https://t.co/NJRRG4F9Nx
